posts._title: Marilyn Fabe – Closely Watched Films: An Introduction to the Art of Narrative Film Technique (2004)
posts.title: Closely Watched Films: An Introduction to the Art of Narrative Film Technique
posts.excerpt: From the preface: How do films work? How do they tell a story? How do they move us and make us think? This book argues that shot-by-shot analysis is the best way for film students to learn about and appreciate the filmmaker’s art. Having taught film studies for many years, Marilyn Fabe has learned that …

posts._title: Dmitriy Babichenko – Boevye Stranicy AKA Combat Pages (1939)
posts.title: Boevye Stranicy
posts.excerpt: Plot:It is a political film-review about the Soviet Army and its struggle against the enemies of the Soviet Union.

posts._title: Pascal Arnold & Jean-Marc Barr – Chroniques sexuelles d’une famille d’aujourd’hui AKA Sexual Chronicles of a French Family (2012)
posts.title: Chroniques sexuelles d’une famille d’aujourd’hui
posts.excerpt: After one of their sons gets caught filming himself masturbating in school, Claire, who never opened up the conversation of sex with her three children, decides to encourage them to explore their sexuality freely and openly.
posts.titleEnglish: Sexual Chronicles of a French Family

posts._title: Maurice Pialat – Les Courts Métrages Turcs AKA The Turkish Chronicles (1964)
posts.title: Les Courts Métrages Turcs
posts.excerpt: Before he turned to feature filmmaking in 1968 with Naked Childhood, Pialat worked on a series of short films, many of them financed by French television. TURKISH CHRONICLES is a compendium of four pieces shot in Turkey. Corne D’Or juxtaposes a poem by Nerval with a powerful study of Ottoman architecture; Istanbul takes into the …

posts._title: Ektoras Lygizos – Agna Niata AKA Pure Youth (2004)
posts.title: Agna Niata
posts.excerpt: A great Greek short with a shocking climax. Screened in competition at the Venice film Festival.

posts._title: William Park – What is Film Noir (2011)
posts.title: What is Film Noir
posts.excerpt: Everyone seems to know what film noir is, but scholars and critics cannot agree on any definition. Some go so far as to insist that there is no such thing. What is Film Noir? claims that this confusion arises from the fact that film noir is both a genre and a period style, and as …

posts.title: Adynata
posts.excerpt: Quote: A formal 1861 portrait of a Chinese Mandarin and his wife is the starting point for this allegorical investigation of the fantasies spawned in the West about the East, particularly that which associates femininity with the mysterious Orient. ADYNATA presents a series of oppositions-male and female images, past and present sounds-which in and of …

posts._title: Tunc Basaran – Ucurtmayi Vurmasinlar AKA Don’t Let Them Shoot the Kite (1989)
posts.title: Ucurtmayi Vurmasinlar
posts.excerpt: from wiki:Uçurtmayı Vurmasınlar (English title: Don’t Let Them Shoot the Kite) is a 1989 Turkish drama film directed by Tunç Başaran. It tells the story of political prisoners in Turkey from the eyes of a child. It is one of the most remembered works in its genre, along with pre-military coup pieces such as Maden. …
posts.titleEnglish: Don’t Let Them Shoot the Kite

posts.title: Ramin
posts.excerpt: From IMDB: Ramin Lomsadze, a 75-years old Georgian wrestler who once won seven matches in 55 seconds, is getting ready for the fight with his last and most formidable opponent – Loneliness. He gets on the train and sets off for a remote Georgian village to seek out the girl he loved and lost fifty …
